title: Research Associate - NMR
summary: Research Associate- NMR in Albany, NY   Albany Molecular Research Inc. provides global contract research and manufacturing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.   The Research Associate has a thorough understanding of the theory and application of NMR spectroscopy. The scientist’s principal responsibility is to perform structural assignments of synthetic compounds as well as impurities and degradants from synthetic processes. The scientist will need to demonstrate strong problem solving skills using NMR technology and will write and review technical reports on a regular basis. The Scientist will also contribute to service and maintenance of NMR spectrometers. Knowledge of and the ability to interpret other analytical techniques such as IR, Raman, MS, etc. is preferred. The scientist is self-motivated and continually demonstrates initiative in handling responsibilities, and strives to do the job better. A major component in the scientist’s performance rating will be based on productivity.   RESPONSIBILITIES  The scientist’s principal responsibility is to perform structural analysis of synthetic compounds as well as impurities and degradants from synthetic processes. The scientist will need to demonstrate strong problem solving skills using NMR technology and provide significant contributions to technical reports. Conduct laboratory operations in a safe manner. Maintain familiarity with the Chemical Hygiene Plan. Exhibit safety awareness and safe work practices. Follow responsible actions regarding chemical disposal. Maintain compliance with all regulations at the federal, state, and local levels, as well as appropriate SOP’s. Develop a thorough understanding of and comply with GMP practices. Develop and maintain working knowledge of commonly used NMR spectroscopy procedures. Write and review NMR spectroscopy method validation protocols and reports. Use and maintain equipment in a neat and orderly manner. Perform service and maintenance of NMR spectrometers. Report any malfunction immediately to supervisor. Interpret and report scientific data clearly and concisely. Submit complete written documentation, notebooks, methods, validation reports, data reports and summaries. Ensure that data is properly filed and accessible for review in accordance with appropriate SOP’s. Communicate effectively in verbal and written form on results, issues, and plans. Use sound judgment and previously acquired knowledge and experience to develop new procedures for new compounds. These procedures may go beyond the normal routine and may involve literature searching, as well as contact with suppliers and customers, etc. Process samples according to standard procedures effectively and independently. Analyze experimental data for validity before reporting results. Adapt to changing priorities such that productivity and efficiency is unaffected. Keep contemporary, accurate, legible, and complete experimental records in accordance with GMP and GLP practices. Use technical and regulatory knowledge and judgment to validate procedures to comply with internal SOPs and regulatory needs with minimal supervision. These procedures may go beyond the normal routine and may require special or unusual validation protocols. Submit complete, documented, and legible reports of analytical testing. Ensure that data is properly filed and accessible for review in accordance with appropriate SOP’s. Qualifications  Education and/or Experience   -Ph.D. with major in analytical or organic chemistry. Advanced NMR course completion required.   -Expertise in theory and application of NMR spectroscopy   -Proficiency in technical writing   -Knowledge of NMR spectrometers   -Experience in maintaining NMR equipment

title: Research Scientist - AUG17-04
summary: DESCRIPTION  Human Resources Research Organization (HumRRO) is an industry leader in designing, developing, and conducting applied research in support of a variety of human capital initiatives and we are looking for talented individuals to join us in these important endeavors.  HumRRO, an independent, nonprofit organization, offers exciting challenges and opportunities in a variety of areas. We provide customized solutions to issues related to personnel selection, strategic human capital management, program evaluation, educational research, program policy and analysis, and other areas that have broad impact.  HumRRO is seeking a motivated individual to contribute to the organizations personnel research and consulting activities. This individual will serve as a member of a team, participate in expansion of existing contracts and development of new business, and ultimately direct projects.  Projects may include: Conducting job analysis; Designing and implementing research and analysis plans; Developing various cognitive and non-cognitive measures, including online role plays, job knowledge tests, situational judgment tests, in-baskets, and logic-based reasoning measures; Collecting and analyzing data and interpreting results; Writing technical reports and orally presenting project findings; Assisting in the development of proposals to secure new contracts.  The position requires knowledge of industrial-organizational psychology and measurement; a strong foundation in applied research design, test construction and validation, methodology and statistics (using SPSS, SAS, and/or R); the ability to ensure technical quality, timeliness, and adherence to budget; and excellent written and oral communication, organizational, and teamwork skills. Candidates should be willing to work on a variety of types of tasks and projects, and possess a desire to learn and develop inventive methods that respond to client needs.  Candidates with a doctoral degree in industrial-organizational psychology or a closely related discipline are preferred; however, those with a masters degree in a relevant discipline and relevant work experience will also be considered.  This position is located in HumRROs Alexandria, VA headquarters office though placement in either the Louisville, KY, Minneapolis, MN, or Monterey, CA offices would be considered under certain circumstances.  All qualified applications will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, medical condition, or disability. EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled.

title: Image Scientist/Engineer- Entry Level
summary: Image Scientist/Engineer- Entry Level(  Job Number: 17006238)  Description  Xerox Corporation (NYSE: XRX) is an $11 billion technology leader that innovates the way the world communicates, connects and works. Our expertise is more important than ever as customers of all sizes look to improve productivity, maximize profitability and increase satisfaction. We do this for small and mid-size businesses, large enterprises, governments, graphic communications providers, and for our partners who serve them. We understand what’s at the heart of work – and all of the forms it can take. We embrace the increasingly complex world of paper and digital. Office and mobile. Personal and social. Every day across the globe – in more than 160 countries – our technology, software and people successfully navigate those intersections. We automate, personalize, package, analyze and secure information to keep our customers moving at an accelerated pace.   Learn more at www.xerox.com.   Image Scientist/Engineer  Xerox Corporation, an industry leader in printing technology and solutions, is looking for an image scientist/engineer or computer scientist to join a dynamic, fast-paced environment developing novel marking technologies. Working with a multi-disciplinary integrated team, he or she will support the design and development efforts in support of printing systems.   Responsibilities include:  Solving complex system through computer programming.  Subsystem integration associated with jetted printing systems.  Design solutions for critical processes, including complex geometries.  System optimization of printing processes in new products, involving the application of disciplines such as image generation, measurement, inspection and closed loop control.  Coordinate efforts of cross-functional teams to develop and deliver solutions on the program’s schedule.  Participate in partnered relationships and projects. Projects may involve interfacing with other external design teams, design partners, and vendors to define and meet associated specifications and deliverables.  Use of process maps, system models, design of experiments, and data analysis techniques to establish critical parameters and design specifications that enable product performance goals.  Translation of business team requirements into technical solutions which can be executed by a cross-functional engineering team.  Plan, conduct and analyze experiments to define and optimize system performance.  Qualifications - External  We are looking for candidates with strong systems design and image processing, computer programming, and performance evaluation skills. title: Research Associate II in Microbiome Research
summary: The Human Gut Microbiome Library is an initiative of the Center for Microbiome Informatics and Therapeutics and The Broad Institute that currently contains several thousand unique isolates from westernized, US-based healthy Human gut microbiomes. This collection will keep growing rapidly in number and diversity, as isolates from samples collected throughout the world are incorporated into this collection. To curate, maintain, and continue developing this library, we are seeking an experienced microbiologist with a track record of technical excellence, methodical project planning and completion, and impeccable organization. You will work under the supervision of Drs. Eric Alm (MIT) and Ramnik Xavier (MGH, and The Broad Institute), co-directors of The Center for Microbiome Informatics and Therapeutics, to exhaustively isolate strains of bacteria from each sample. In many cases these samples will be irreplaceable. You will be able to independently identify, troubleshoot, and refine protocols to successfully isolate bacterial species that are typically considered to be difficult to culture or “unculturable”. You will work with our core team to identify and characterize each strain. Clear, and complete written documentation and collation of all information relevant to each strain will be methodically deposited in our newly developed database, including for example, the successful culture conditions, as well genomic and metabolomic data. As this library has been developed to be a foundation for future microbiome research, strains will be available for use for non-profit research. As the curator of the library, you will directly interact with anyone requesting strains. You will be responsible for fulfilling their requests, and answering any questions they may have. The ability to effectively communicate with all levels of staff and external collaborators is an essential part of this job. Excellent documentation of all strains shared is essential and must be logged in our purpose-built database. The successful library curator will have the exciting opportunity to make an impact in the rapidly growing field of microbiome research! Qualifications Qualified candidates should possess a Masters degree in Microbiology, or a related field with at least 2 years of research experience that can be concurrent with the degree Candidate must be a rigorous scientist who excels at independent work and who is proficient in a broad array of standard and specialized microbiology techniques including anaerobic microbiology, that can be applied to strain isolation and culturing, and maintaining frozen stocks Must be meticulous and organized to keep track and catalogue precious samples, and bacterial isolates Must be able to clearly document all information related to culturing and characterization of each isolate in a database Must possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with multiple teams in a collaborative environment, as well as with external researchers Experience working with clinical samples is preferred Detailed knowledge of and specific experience in 16S, and/or metagenomic library preparation is a plus EOE / Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabilities

title: Associate Scientist
summary: Associate Scientist - (EUG-PRD-18124)   Description  About the role: We are looking for a bench scientist for the development of novel immunoassays in our Eugene, OR facility. This vital role will be responsible for the development, characterization and optimization of novel reagents, antibodies and immunoassay kit products for commercialization to life science researchers.   About the dept: The Associate Scientist will join a growing and dedicated group of life science professionals focused on developing high quality products.   Essential Responsibilities: • Develop high-quality, robust antibodies and immunoassay kits with associated documentation.  • Independently design, plan and conduct laboratory experiments in support of new product development.  • Identify and resolve problems in experimental design and outcomes.  • Communicate and work effectively in fast-paced team environment.  • Maintain good laboratory records and presentation of regular internal research reports.  • Provide clear manufacturing instructions, QC specifications and technical support to the manufacturing team for developed products including details of performance, stability and packaging.  • Provide technical assistance and marketing support to the commercial operations selling reagents, antibodies, and immunoassay kits.  • Comply with all safety and quality regulations.  • Routine maintenance and troubleshooting of scientific equipment.  • May be required to perform other duties as required/assigned.   About you: You’re a BS or MS level scientist with a strong background in antibodies and immunoassays. You will have a natural inclination toward solving technical problems and a passion for product development and teamwork.  Minimum Qualifications: • BS degree in science and 4 years of related lab experience  • Two years of experience working with antibodies, immunoassays, flow cytometry and chemical conjugations   Preferred Qualifications: • MS degree in science and 3 years of related experience  • One year of experience in Life Sciences reagents industry  • Critical thinking and independent judgment with only general direction necessary.  • Experience with development and optimization of antibodies and single/multiplex immunoassays.  • Experience in antibody applications including flow cytometry, immunofluorescence microscopy, Western blotting, ELISA and antibody conjugations.  • Cell culture and specimen handling experience.  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, and in product development, experimental design, and data analysis.  • Strong oral and written communication skills.  • Excellent computer skills including instrumentation specific software, and proficiency in Microsoft office.   If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast paced, growing business with the vision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences please apply now!   About Us: Ever since 1998, when our founder, Jonathan Milner, started selling antibodies from the back of his bike, Abcam has aimed to help scientific researchers make breakthroughs faster. We now have offices and labs in the UK, the US, China and Japan, and as we continue to grow, we remain ambitious, driven by our customers’ success and their research needs.   It’s our goal to provide a world-standard in protein research tools, technical support and delivery. When you join Abcam, you’ll join a global business with the passion and the vision to become the most influential company, and, best-loved brand in life sciences.  Our culture is our key differentiator. We believe in empowering individuals, with responsibility given at an early stage. The working environment is fun and fast-paced, collaborative and outcome focused, with a strong customer focus. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package (which includes shares for eligible employees), a culture focused on wellbeing and opportunities for growth and development.   Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Packaging Analyst
summary: McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor & seasonings industry, is seeking a full time Packaging Analyst within Consumer Products Division (CPD) of Research & Development at the Technical Innovation Center (TIC) located on Wight Avenue in Hunt Valley, MD. This Analyst will report to the Director of Packaging Development.  With more than $4 billion in annual sales, McCormick manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry – retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food McCormick flavored. McCormick makes every meal and moment better™! To learn more about us, please visit www.mccormickcorporation.com.  As an employer recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services including, but not limited to, tuition assistance, medical & dental, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing plan, paid holidays and vacations.  MCCORMICK’S TECHNICAL INNOVATION CENTER (TIC)  McCormick’s R&D has an unparalleled record of successful innovation creating flavors for products that matter. Today, more than ever, our team of top sensory, analytical, & materials scientists and research chefs – our innovation enablers – are helping us develop a new generation of tools to create products to satisfy consumers’ quests for authentic, premium flavor, to meet the exploding demand for positive nutrition, and to address the critical need for sustainable manufacturing and food safety.  We provide a high-quality R&D environment with an emphasis on teamwork, customer satisfaction, and interdepartmental cooperation. State-of-the-art equipment and facilities exist in laboratories devoted both to basic and applied research and product development with excellence in chemistry, microbiology, microscopy, molecular biology, engineering, sensory science, culinary science, & flavor and seasoning creation and applications. Our “passion for flavor” extends to customers around the globe.  POSITION OVERVIEW: The Packaging Analyst is responsible for managing packaging specifications, Fit For Use documentation, test methods, STEP/NPC activities, and SAP for all packaging development activities. This Analyst supports new products, cost savings projects and manufacturing / supply chain improvements. This role combines technical knowledge, project management skills and cross-functional teamwork to provide a strong source of packaging capabilities. The Packaging Analyst supports business needs across North America for the Consumer Products (retail) Division (CPD) and in both internal and external manufacturing locations  RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as SAP subject matter expert for all packaging functionality, updates, roll out support globally, system/process documentation and training Manage specifications to include standard practice, content accuracy and consistency, supplier review/approval process, approval workflow process, auditing, documentation and training Provide laboratory support including test method creation & maintenance as well as SOP creation & maintenance Provide back-up support for laboratory testing and AutoCAD technical drawings Manage STEP/NPC process and serve as department subject matter expert (SME) for this Colaborate & participate in project activities across levels and functions Ensure deadlines and expectations are met  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree in Packaging Science, Material Science, Food Science, Chemistry, Engineering, or another technical discipline Minimum 2 years of experience in a technical area such as Packaging, Product Development, Quality Assurance, Engineering within the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry Experience managing cross functional projects within the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry Strong math and analytical skills to evaluate data for recommendations Creative problem solving skills, attention to detail and superior organization skills Must be process driven Strong communication and interpersonal skills Experience successfully prioritizing work and managing several projects at a time  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Food industry experience Manufacturing plant exposure Applied knowledge in areas of packaging materials (such as corrugated, cartons, labels, laminates, rigid plastics, etc.) Experience with SAP, CAPE, AutoCAD, Microsoft Word, Project, Excel, PowerPoint Experience writing comprehensive packaging specifications, including functional parameters for the consumer and for manufacturing  McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future. You must be lawfully authorized to commence work upon being offered employment.

title: Biocuration Scientist
summary: Stanford University Department of Genetics has an excellent opportunity available for a motivated Biocuration Scientist. This individual will work with projects funded to coordinate and integrate data from model organism research as part of the Saccharomyces Genome Database project (SGD, http://www.yeastgenome.org) funded by the National Institutes of Health. This individual will be an essential project member who will identify genetic data from scientific articles concerning primarily yeast, and record these data regarding genes, alleles, and proteins in a systematic manner. Other data to be captured include phenotypes, gene product functions, and models of human disease. Curated data are entered into SGD and made freely available to the public.   The successful candidate will have thorough biological knowledge, including familiarity with high-throughput experimental methodologies, large genomic datasets, and their analysis in order to successfully describe these data. Prior laboratory experience generating and analyzing genomic datasets is desired. Familiarity with the use of controlled vocabularies and ontologies to describe biological concepts is a plus. An advanced education in a biological field is required to facilitate the assessment of experimental details, results, and data. This individual will be also responsible for working with other curation and software engineering staff in the specification, design, and implementation of tools that integrate, search, and display these data.   Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential in order to (1) interact effectively with members of the scientific community, (2) facilitate the acquisition and description of scientific data, (3) effectively provide documentation and specifications to coworkers during tool development, and (4) contribute to publications and tutorials.   The successful candidate must be able to learn and work independently, yet collaborate well with coworkers. Previous experience working in an academic environment is a plus. The work will take place in a dynamic environment where specifications often change rapidly in response to various demands, so the candidate must remain flexible and adaptable. The successful candidate will work at Stanford University in Palo Alto, California.   Duties include:  Collect and analyze information from peer-reviewed scientific journals and through direct submissions; abstract data into the required format, and verify them for accuracy. Review submissions to the database for quality and relevancy; abstract information in the required formats. Compile and create educated summaries of the literature, discovering new facts by analyzing the collected data. Participate in presentations and demonstrations of the database at conferences or other institutions.  * - Other duties may also be assigned   Qualifications  DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  Prior laboratory experience generating and analyzing genomic datasets is desired. Familiarity with the use of controlled vocabularies and ontologies to describe biological concepts is a plus. Previous experience working in an academic environment is a plus.  EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):   Master's degree in scientific field and three years of relevant experience or combination of relevant experience.   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):  Strong analytical skills. Ability to learn and utilize relational databases, data integration, and statistics. Strong written and oral English communication skills. Computer skills, including word processing and spreadsheet applications. Ability to understand scientific literature, experimental procedures and their limitations, and current needs of the research community.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (DESIRED):  Technical expertise in genetics, molecular biology, and/or bioinformatics. Experience with laboratory methods in genomics. Familiarity with modern high-throughput genomics and proteomics experiments and their data types. Familiarity with controlled vocabularies and ontologies. Experience with computer programming (scripting). Experience with data quality assessment.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:   Frequently perform desk based computer tasks, seated work and use light/ fine grasping. Occasionally stand, walk, and write by hand, lift, carry, push pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.   * - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.   WORKING CONDITIONS:  May work extended or non-standard hours based on project or business needs. Occasional local travel may be required. Some work may be performed in a laboratory setting.  WORK STANDARDS:  Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations. Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned. Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.  Job : Information Analytics  Location : School of Medicine   Department URL : http://genetics.stanford.edu/  Schedule : Full-time  Grade : H  Job Code : 4182

title: Field Application Scientist
summary: The Field Application Specialist I provides scientific support to account managers, new and existing customers in accounts in Maryland/Virginia Territory. This position will carry out evaluations at prospect sites for new instrument opportunities, support new and existing customers in the use of MSD kitted assays and in the development of new assays in a multidisciplinary setting. The candidate should be based in or near Rockville, MD.   JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:   - Educate, train and support new/existing customers on MSD instrumentation and data analysis.   - Train customers on the use of MSD assays, instrumentation and software   - Assist existing customers with assay troubleshooting and data analysis   - Provide support for customers wishing to develop their own assays on the MSD platform   - May include but not be limited to inflammation, oncology, metabolic disorders, neuroscience, immunogenicity, PK, toxicology, bioproduction   - Attend scientific meetings, conferences and trade shows, provide feedback and reports   - Travel 30 to 50% of the time; able to work at customer sites four days a week Work as part of a team and integrate information between sales and marketing groups to provide resolution of customer issues and expand the customer base through scientific networking.   - Integrate with account managers in the strategic selling process to grow instrument and consumable sales in the territory   - Present scientific seminars to prospects   - Create reports and presentations from assay development visits and new evaluations   - Provide feedback from the field to other team members, account managers and internal groups o Document activities and customer interactions in the CRM software (SalesForce.com) Specific duties may vary depending upon departmental requirements. Candidates should also expect to spend time in a laboratory environment occasionally working with blood products and various allergens.

title: PT Lecturer Data Management
summary: The College of Computer and Information Science invites applications for the position of Part-Time online teaching faculty. Primary responsibilities will be teaching an online course in the area of data analytics- introduction to data management and data mining/machine learning. We are looking for teaching during the spring semester of 2018. Salary is competitive and additional teaching opportunities are available. For more information about the program, please visit http://www.northeastern.edu/datascience/  Qualifications: Candidates must have an MS degree in a related field. PhD and teaching experience strongly preferred.  Additional Information: The course studies how to build large-scale information repositories of different types of information objects so that they can be selected, retrieved, and transformed for analytics and discovery, including statistical analysis. Analyzes how traditional approaches to data storage can be applied alongside modern approaches that use nonrelational data structures. Through case studies, readings on background theory, and hands-on experimentation, offers students an opportunity to learn how to select, plan, and implement storage, search, and retrieval components of large-scale structured and unstructured information repositories. Emphasizes how to assess and recommend efficient and effective large-scale information storage and retrieval components that provide data scientists with properly structured, accurate, and reliable access to information needed for investigation. title: Research Scientist
summary: Working at the intersection of hardware, software, and molecular science, we are committed to delivering on the promise of 3D printing, enabling commercial customers to go beyond basic prototyping to 3D manufacturing.   Our company is built on the idea that when diverse fields of study come together, we are able to solve challenging problems. We have grand dreams to build technology that will influence industries around the world. You will be joining a diverse team with a dynamic culture, where team success is as important as celebrating individual contributions.   Help us change the world, and we will help you change yours.   We are looking for an extraordinary polymer scientist to develop novel materials for our 3D printing platform. Materials are at the core of what we do. Our materials are used for applications such as prototyping, dental, biomedical, automotive, aerospace, footwear, investment casting, and many more. You will work as part of a cohesive and high-energy team, but also direct individual projects and have freedom to execute as you see fit.   Responsibilities: Validate consistency of key raw materials in resins, and help setting specs for raw materials Test incoming batches of resins to validate consistency, and trouble-shoot for causes leading to variations Test robustness of different resin formulations including high/low temperature stability and long term storage stability Participate in formulation and scale-up of developed products Print formulations to understand how printing parameters, liquid and cured properties of resin affect the final outcome of the product. Requirements: BS or MS with background in polymer, chemistry, materials science, and chemical engineering. Hands on experience in formulations, and attention to details Experience with UV-curing chemistry and/or polyurethane chemistry Strong analytical skills with good data tracking and presentation ability Safety conscious individual who actively promotes safe behavior in the department and takes responsibility for safe lab operations Carbon is an equal opportunity employer.

title: BioWatch Lead Biological Scientist - Miami, FL
summary: POSITION: BIOWATCH LEAD BIOLOGICAL SCIENTIST  LOCATION: Miami, FL  STATUS: Full Time/Contingent **Actively Interviewing**  TRAVEL: Minimal, including travel to the Systems Program Office (SPO) in the Washington, D.C. area for briefings and meetings, and to attend the annual National BioWatch Workshop.  CLEARANCE: Ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance.  BENEFITS: 401K; Life/Health/Dental/Disability Insurance; Paid Time Off; and Tuition Reimbursement.  JOB DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) mission is to ensure a homeland that is safe, secure, and resilient against terrorism and other hazards. The DHS Office of Health Affairs (OHA) provides medical, health, and scientific expertise in support of the DHS mission to prepare for, respond to, and recover from all threats. The BioWatch Systems Program Office (SPO) within OHA supports this mission through the BioWatch program, the only civilian program that monitors for the aerosol release of bioterrorism agents. The Mission of the BioWatch program is to provide and maintain a continuous bio-terrorism air monitoring system in large metropolitan areas and coordinate with state and local public health communities to prepare for and respond to a bioterrorist event. Established in 2003, BioWatch continuously monitors select urban environments twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week. The BioWatch program’s Strategic Objectives include:  Monitor for highest priority biological agents that could result in catastrophic outcomes;  Provide protection in the most at-risk locations of the nation;  Maintain the technical oversight of operations in close collaboration with state and local public health partners who execute the program;  Modify current detection methods to improve capability at a lower cost for the Federal Government;  Coordinate Federal, State, and local public health preparedness planning activities to develop operational protocols for a BioWatch Actionable Result (BAR); and  Continue to strengthen Federal, State, and local partnerships and build efficiencies.The BioWatch program consists of distinct operational components including field, laboratory and public health. The field component conducts daily collection of air filter samples for delivery to a state or local Laboratory Response Network (LRN) laboratory. The public health component develops response plans and manages the local public response in the event of a BioWatch Actionable Result. The Laboratory Component provides capabilities to analyze collected samples to detect the presence of select biological agents and report the results. The BioWatch SPO currently provides contracted laboratory staff to most BioWatch LRN laboratories to perform the laboratory analysis under the guidance of the local Laboratory Director, Scope of Work.  The scope of this effort includes two distinct services to be performed: provide BioWatch laboratory and support staff and develop, implement and track a Quality Assurance Surveillance Program (QASP) for the BioWatch SPO. The objective of this contract is to provide support in the form of sample analysis to detect the presence of select biological agents from samples collected in a continuous aerosol bio-terrorism monitoring network in selected metropolitan areas.  Primary duties will include (but not limited to) : Troubleshoot technical/laboratory issues in conjunction with the local Laboratory Director and/or their designee;  Develop and maintain BioWatch personnel work schedules;  Ensure training of new employees and competency of all laboratorians by observing personnel on an annual basis;  Conduct refresher training when protocols are updated and as required;  Review inventory and order consumable supplies and reagents, maintaining a three-month supply, at minimum (or the greatest amount possible when space availability is limited);  Generate and maintain documentation in accordance with SOPs and the QAPP; and  Support the Local Laboratory Director in the generation and execution of a corrective action plan in accordance with the BioWatch Laboratory QAPP to address any findings from the BioWatch Quality Assurance program audits, proficiency tests, or data trend analysis.  Under routine day-to-day operations, shall perform all required BioWatch operational sample analysis (screen and necessary confirmation) within twelve (12) hours of receipt of samples by the laboratory. This does not include some non-routine samples run at specific sites.  Shall perform, at a minimum, the following tasks/responsibilities in accordance with BioWatch standard operating procedures under the auspices of the state/local Laboratory Director (or designee):  Handling, receipt and processing of operational, Quality Assurance, and proficiency test samples potentially containing biological threat agents;  Performing non-research biological science work utilizing microbiological and molecular techniques, including DNA extraction and real-time polymerase chain reaction (PCR), to identify and characterize pathogenic bacterial and viral agents;  Preparing reagents and samples;  Decontaminating hoods, biological safety cabinets, equipment and other working areas;  Maintaining chain-of-custody (COC);  Interpreting results;  Entering data owned by the state/local public health laboratory into computerized or computer-linked systems;  Performing equipment maintenance and calibration;  Cleaning and assembling specialized equipment;  Collecting, processing and analyzing internal laboratory swipes/swabs for Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC);  Autoclaving and/or disposing of bio-hazardous trash;  Restocking and inventorying supplies;  Supporting BioWatch Laboratory Logistics Manager (BWLLM) in conducting and documenting a yearly inventory of all DHS-procured durable equipment and property provided to each BioWatch laboratory;  QA/QC of reagents in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures;  Providing training on BioWatch protocols and procedures for new personnel/retraining requirements, as needed Documenting COC, QA/QC, equipment maintenance and calibration, training and data results;  Adhering to QA/QC requirements in accordance with Public Health Laboratory quality management systems and the BioWatch Laboratory Quality Assurance Program Plan (QAPP). Archiving samples;  Performing daily functions and internal proficiency tests as defined by the state or local Laboratory Director (or designee), and successfully pass external proficiency tests (given by DHS and/or DHS designee) and BioWatch Quality Assurance Program audits as defined by DHS and the BioWatch SPO in the QAPP; and  Analyzing daily external QA samples in accordance with BioWatch SOP’s and QA program guidance for screening and confirmatory assays.  Perform other duties as assigned.  Additional Requirements: Must be able to pass a background check.  Must be able to meet state/local accreditation requirements, e.g., Select Agent Registration, American Society of Clinical Pathologist (ASCP) as determined by each local Laboratory Director, as provided in the final RFP).  Must be able to register with the CDC Select Agent Program (if their non-BioWatch and/or BioWatch duties require them to work with select agents, including quality control).  Must be able to sign a non-disclosure agreement (NDA) with the Contractor that meets or exceeds the requirements of a DHS NDA.  Must be able to sign appropriate LRN paperwork for access to LRN reagents.  Must be a U.S. citizen or an alien who has been lawfully admitted for permanent residence as evidenced by a Permanent Resident Card (USCIS-I-551). title: Research Analyst (Labor, Human Services & Population Policy Center)
summary: Who we are: At the nonprofit Urban Institute, we believe in the power of evidence to improve lives and strengthen communities. Our employees are empowered to influence policy, open minds, shape decisions and offer solutions. We encourage intellectual honesty, innovation, diversity, and mutual respect, and our analysis elevates the debate, wherever it takes place. How you’ll contribute: The Research Analyst is responsible for assisting senior researchers in various policy areas such as labor and workforce development, child welfare, vulnerable youth, early childhood education, low-income working families, immigration, demographic change, social determinants of health, or asset building and wealth accumulation among low-income populations. The research analyst will conduct literature reviews, interviews for qualitative studies, as well as participate in reporting research findings and presenting data. In addition, research analysts may conduct quantitative analyses and programming tasks. The specific candidate will work primarily on youth workforce development initiatives, especially apprenticeship programs and programs to support foster youth to enter the labor market. The need for flexibility is a must. Responsibilities include: Prepare interview and focus group protocols, manage recruitment, and lead and support research team in collecting qualitative data through site visits and phone data collection Analyze qualitative data to draw out key themes using qualitative data software (NVIVO, AtlasTi) Assist in the development and administration of surveys and questionnaires Contribute to presentations, reports, articles, policy briefs, and other written materials Manage proposal and project budgets, organize internal and external meetings, develop meeting materials, create project timelines and schedules, coordinate communication with outside partners, and help manage the timely delivery of progress reports and deliverables Review and evaluate prior research to provide insight and write literature reviews for proposals, briefs, and project reports Communicate effectively with multiple research teams and project leaders Assemble and analyze quantitative data and produce tables and graphics as needed Manage junior staff on projects Provide support to other areas of the Urban Institute as needed Plan and prepare for substantive interactions with researchers, policymakers, and government officials Provide background support for drafting content for occupational frameworks, emails, websites, presentations, and talking points for internal and external audiences Contribute to network building with industry stakeholders What you’ll bring: The successful candidate will have: An MA in Public Policy, Economics, Sociology, Political Science, Statistics, or other social science fields with a proven interest in Labor/Workforce Development, especially for disadvantaged youth Strong qualitative skills, with library and intranet research experience Prior experience developing surveys and protocols, collecting qualitative data through site visits and phone interviews, and analyzing qualitative data using qualitative data software (e.g. NVIVO, AtlasTi) Prior experience writing up qualitative research results in briefs, reports, and presentations Experience networking and establishing relationships with internal and external contacts Outstanding writing ability, problem solving ability, strong oral communication, excellent organizational skills, the ability to work effectively on multiple projects. and to take initiative in a fast-paced environment Proficiency with spreadsheet, statistical, and presentation graphics software. What you’ll experience: Working in the Nation’s Capital, the epicenter of public policy among a network of policy experts, you can expect to have an impact on policy areas you care about and work with great colleagues who are smart, mission-driven, and collaborative. You will blend academic rigor with on-the-ground collaboration, be encouraged and supported to fulfill your potential through meaningful work that matters and, enjoy a welcoming workplace free from harassment, discrimination and intolerance. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage. Competitive paid time off allowance, and eligibility to participate in a generous retirement savings plan plus elect a pretax benefit for commuting expenses. The Urban Institute is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other protected status under applicable law. title: Research Analyst - SQL SPSS
summary: Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in the Mission, Cyber, and Intelligence Solutions group. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.   Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Research Analyst to join our team in the Northern Virginia area to provide unparalleled support to our customer and to begin an exciting and rewarding career within ManTech.   Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:   • Deliver analysis for the identification and analysis of transnational criminal organizations, their future actions, and their methods.   • Search and analyze intelligence data, synthesize intelligence information into relationship or threat model data, and infer the confidence level and completeness of the information.   • Research additional sources such as trade, travel, criminal activity, and money movement to isolate actors, activities, and networks that represent threats to the US security or legal trade and travel.   • Provide analytical support for the development of analytic models to identify networks, predict future threats, and isolate and evaluate threat scenarios.   • Work in data science teams that include intelligence analysts, data and visualization experts, and software developers.   • Construct of dossiers for specific threats.   • Prepare documentation validating reasoning, certainty, and completeness in synthesized information.   Additional Responsbilities:   • Ingest data RFIs and query a complex database using SQL (or other approved software)   • Provide time-sensitive, ad-hoc data queries from complex datasets:   o Ingest quick-turn, ad-hoc data RFIs   o Normalize provided data and perform preliminary data analysis to clean and parse data for ingest   o Query complex datasets using SQL and other software (particularly SPSS)   • Conduct data analysis on the findings   • Work with various operational teams and subject matter experts to clarify RFIs and needs of requestors   • Utilize MS Excel, Python, MS VBA, and other tools to consolidate and format queried data for delivery to requestor   • Work with analysts and subject matter experts to narrow problem set and present logical conclusions about the data and translate the information into a written narrative   • Brief representatives of various DHS agencies on findings   • Build trusting relationships with officers who will depend on the fidelity of your work to make operational decisions   Position Requirements:  • High School Diploma and five plus years of intelligence analysis experience, or specialized training and/or, equivalent intelligence/academic experience; such as Associates degree OR above and three years of experience, OR a Master degree.   • Ability to collect, evaluate, analyze and abstract data from specific sources; compiling the data into finished analysis and reports.   • Ability to work with open source data, to include social media; structured and unstructured data profiling; rules engines.   • Demonstrated understanding of large, complex transaction data, with the ability to synthesize information from large amounts of data.   • Experience in community and threat Identification.   • Experience presenting work to both technical and non-technical audiences.   • Experience evaluating uncertainty in relationship data.   • Experience working in law enforcement or classified intelligence analysis environment.   Additional Requirements:   •Ability to obtain a Full CBP BI   •Experience in a fast paced, Operational/Law Enforcement (not necessarily Intelligence) environment   •SQL a must, plus a willingness to learn other software (R, SPSS, i2, etc.).   •Ability to interact with both database administrators and law enforcement personnel.   •Experience in a fast paced, Operational/Law Enforcement (not necessarily Intelligence) environment   •SQL a must, SPSS a plus, must be willing and able to learn other software (VBA, Python, R, i2, etc.)   •Ability to interact with both database administrators and law enforcement personnel   •Build trusting relationships with officers who will depend on the fidelity of your work to make operational decisions   Qualifications  Requires Bachelor's degree or equivalent and five to seven years of related experience and proficient in use of computer-spread sheets, databases and other related tools. title: Temporary Research Associate, Molecular Biology
summary: At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a motivated Research Associate to join our dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.   Successful candidates for the position will work under the direction of R&D scientists on the Synthetic Systems and DNA Technologies team, and will support innovative experimental research aiming to advance the development and commercialization of novel microbial production platforms.   Required skills  •Proficient in general molecular biology techniques including DNA construct design, PCR, molecular cloning, plasmid purification, and interpretation of DNA sequencing results.  •Proficient in expression and purification of recombinant proteins from microbial systems.  •A strong theoretical understanding of molecular/cell biology and genetic engineering principles.  •Skills in propagating common laboratory microorganisms, with particular emphasis on aseptic technique and clonal propagation.  •Ability to read, understand, and execute experiments from scientific literature.  •Generates detailed and complete notebooks and presents data-supported conclusions in written and oral reports.  •Excellent written and oral communication and skills.  •Must be able to work collaboratively and flexibly as part of a dynamic, cross-disciplinary team, and to adapt to changing project demands.  •Ability to multitask.  •Consistently demonstrates initiative and follow-through in implementing projects and tasks.  •Motivated learner, capable of quickly getting up to speed on new techniques, methods, or biological systems.  •Passionate and excited about scientific advancement with strong commitment to excellence.  •Works in accordance with health and safety guidelines.  Required Experience  •Requires a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Cell Biology, Genetics, or related discipline, and at least six months of research experience in a relevant laboratory setting.  •Requires knowledge of, and direct experience with, common molecular biology and protein expression/purification methodologies.  •Experience functioning as part of a team, requiring excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Desired Experience  •Experience with DNA sequence analysis/design software tools such as CLC Workbench or vector-NTI.  •Track record in genome engineering of microorganisms.  •Exposure to the field of Synthetic Biology.  •Experience publishing and presenting scientific findings. title: Scientist IV GS15
summary: CAMRIS International is an international development and research firm that realizes innovative solutions to health and development challenges through high-quality, cost-effective program and research management services. With experience working in more than 80 countries, we combine our proven systems with today’s most effective, evidence-based best practices to improve the lives of people around the world. We apply a customized, customer-centric, cost-effective business approach to offer greater value to our clients and challenge the way things have always been done in our field.  CAMRIS clients include U.S. government agencies and multilateral and private organizations. Our core practice areas include public health, agriculture and food security, economic development, education, environment, humanitarian assistance, democracy and governance, and medical research.  The Joint Program Executive Office for Chemical and Biological Defense (JPEO-CBD) has ongoing requirements for program management, systems engineering, and technical advisory and assistance contract services to support the research, development, production, procurement, fielding, sustainment, and continuous product improvement of Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and High-Yield Explosive (CBRNE) Defense systems.  The JPEO-CBD manages a dynamic and diverse portfolio of critical warfighting capabilities, requiring an approach for cohesive and innovative total life cycle systems management to rapidly respond to customer needs in a cost-effective manner. The JPEO-CBD is the Joint Services advanced developer for research, development, acquisition, production, procurement, fielding, and life-cycle sustainment support of Chemical and Biological Defense (CBD) equipment and medical countermeasures systems. The JPEO-CBD supports all military services, as well as homeland defense, allies, and United States (US) citizens and troops located within and outside of the Continental US (CONUS and OCONUS).  Under the Joint Enterprise-Omnibus Program, Engineering, and Technical Support-Logistical and Medical (JE-OEPTS-LM) requirement, CAMRIS may be required to fulfill the medical portion of this requirement which includes all support associated with the product concept and design, and policy and protocol development of all JPEO-CBD systems relating to biologics, vaccines and pharmaceuticals. To facilitate this support requirement, the JPEO-CBD has identified the following areas of interest to categorize Science, Pharmaceutical, Vaccine/Biologics, Management.  This is an opportunity for employment or a contract, but we reserve the right to make no selection or award. Contingent on bid award. Responsibilities The offeror shall provide scientific oversight and technical knowledge in the areas of bioengineering, biology, chemistry, and vaccine development.  The offeror shall support and analyze the development of medical technologies.  The offeror shall author and edit documents, reports, and briefings; interpret technical data, specifications, and requirements; and assist in development of risk management efforts.  Additionally, the offeror shall work closely with the product team to solve problems and ensure application of appropriate scientific principles to meet technical requirements.

title: Formulation Scientist
summary: The Formulation Scientist is responsible for formulation development of sterile injectable dosage forms from pre-clinical development through later phases of a clinical program and commercialization. The Formulation Scientist will collaborate with project team members to define the dosage form requirements, create the experimental plan, and conduct studies in collaboration with external partners to specify formulation composition, container closure system, and manufacturing process. Provide subject matter expertise in relevant aspects of sterile product development. Duties and responsibilities  Responsibilities include:  Identify drug product critical quality attributes impacting safety, efficacy, and manufacturing robustness. Provide input to define phase appropriate regulatory specifications. Experimental design, data evaluation, generation of scientific reports, and coordination of studies with VenatoRx scientists and external partners. Review and approve reports authored by external development partners for technical accuracy and completeness. Plays an important role in the scale-up and technology transfer process in collaboration with CDMOs. Utilizes expertise in sterile product development, and knowledge of chemistry and/or physical chemistry, to investigate, troubleshoot and resolve issues arising during development studies and/or contract manufacturing. Author CTD modules, and/or relevant source documents to support regulatory submissions (IND through NDA). Collaborate with CMC and Regulatory Affairs to respond to questions from regulatory authorities. Author drug product background information to facilitate productive discussions with regulatory authorities. Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of regulatory guidance pertaining to drug product development and commercialization. Collaborate with project teams to meet project objectives, budget, and timelines.  Qualifications  Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate:  A minimum of 5 years experience in sterile dosage form product development. Experience partnering with CDMOs on product development and clinical manufacturing. Experience authoring Investigational New Drug (IND) applications Strong organizational and communication skills. Self-starter and a team player that will thrive in an entrepreneurial environment. A B.S./B.S.E. in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Pharmaceutical Sciences or other relevant scientific discipline.  Ideal candidates will be able to demonstrate:  A graduate degree in in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or other relevant scientific discipline. Experience in late phase development activities, e.g. manufacture of drug product supplies for pivotal clinical trials, registration stability studies, and process validation. Familiarity with analytical methods relevant to development and characterization of parenteral products. Experience authoring New Drug Applications (NDA) and responding to CMC questions from FDA/international regulatory authorities. title: Sr Data Analyst
summary: ASML   ASML is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of lithography systems that help enable Moore’s Law and the creation of increasingly powerful and capable electronic devices. At our San Diego location we are renowned for developing both deep ultraviolet (DUV) lithography light sources and next generation extreme ultraviolet (EUV) light sources. We are a multinational company with over 70 locations in 16 countries, headquartered in Veldhoven, the Netherlands.   If you have a passion for technology and innovation you’ll want to check us out. Be a part of ASML. Be a part of progress.   SUMMARY   The Senior Data Analyst role is a challenging position that will employ a variety of tools and techniques to analyze information collected by the system itself and by products used to monitor the system. The Data Analyst works closely with Customer Support, Field Service Management, Engineers and Scientists and other key cross-functional groups to identify key system performance indicators, and assist in system maintenance, service predictors, field trend analysis, and machine performance metrics.   DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Develops methods and processes used for data extraction, system performance analysis and presentation ready report generation capabilities Utilizes SPC monitoring and performance analysis tools for installed based system performance monitoring aimed at identifying service and maintenance event requirements. Work with internal system scientists and engineers to translate their observations and analysis into service or lifetime indicators for the field use. Ensure key knowledge databases are monitored, reconciled and data input completed necessary to maintain analysis at Regional and Corporate levels. Ensure that real-time monitoring of product occurs and is measured and reported per established performance goals Assist in establishment of methods to monitor key system metrics; update metric data collection systems for changes to key system metrics Needs to identify events and trends and initiate investigations into those events Analyze performance trends at each level to identify process improvements, training opportunities, service event opportunities, etc. Train service personnel in use and interpretation of trend data. Strong communications and presentation skills. QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or Statistics or related field. Minimum six (6) years’ experience with scientific or machine data, semiconductor industry preferred. Database design and web dashboard development experience is required. Must be able to handle multiple projects and manage multiple priorities with minimum assistance. Must be able to validate data, extract pertinent information, identify key trends, and present the information in a clear and concise method to appropriate groups, including but not limited to line personnel, engineers, scientists and executives, both internally and externally. Excel Visual Basic and MATLAB/R applications experience plus! The right candidate will have a high level of tenacious curiosity, analysis skills, attention to detail, and technical competency with a balanced sense of priority and urgency. Demonstrated ability to complete projects on time and deliver results. Strong analytical, computer application, communication skills. Genuine commitment to internal and external customer satisfaction. PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This position is in the National Security Engineering Division (NSED) within the Engineering Directorate. This position is dual-listed in the Physical and Life Sciences Directorate. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted.  Note: This is a one year Postdoctoral appointment with the possibility of extension to a maximum of three years. Eligible candidates are recent PhDs within five years of the month of the degree award at time of hire date. This position is also listed as 102493 in the Physical and LIfe Sciences Directorate.  About Us Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), located in the San Francisco Bay Area (East Bay), is a premier applied science laboratory that is part of the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) within the Department of Energy (DOE). title: Research Scientist - Atmospheric Physics
summary: Status:   US Citizenship Required:  Yes   Job Description:   SSAI is seeking a Research Scientist to support scientific analysis with the High Spectral Resolution Lidar (HSRL) team within the Science Directorate at NASA Langley Research Center. The applicant will study and develop techniques to analyze the optical and microphysical properties of cloud and aerosol retrievals from multi-wavelength airborne and ground-based lidar systems. This work will include comparative analyses of lidar records with measurements and retrievals from surface and airborne in situ instruments and surface, airborne, and satellite remote sensing sensors. The successful candidate will characterize how aerosol properties vary near and below clouds and relate aerosol properties to cloud condensation nuclei concentrations. This person will also work with the HSRL team in the collection, processing, and analyses of airborne HSRL datasets and the analyses of associated data. This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic, self-starter with the ability to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic and collaborative environment.   Required Qualifications:  Advanced degree (M.S. or higher) in Atmospheric Physics, Meteorology, Space Science, or comparable field of study Demonstrated experience with analysis software such as Matlab, IDL or C/C++ Capable of working both independently and within a dynamic science team Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must, as demonstrated by first-author papers published in peer-reviewed publications, and/or oral presentations made at major science conferences. US citizenship is required  Desired Qualifications:  Experience working with and manipulating large data sets. Strong mathematical and statistical skills.

title: Scientist, Vector Characterization
summary: Lentiviral Vectors  bluebird bio is developing potentially transformative, one-time gene therapies for severe genetic and orphan diseases. At the heart of bluebird bio’s product creation efforts is its broadly applicable gene therapy platform for the development of new treatments for diseases with few or no clinical options. bluebird bio has two clinical stage product candidates in development, one for childhood cerebral adrenoleukodystrophy (CCALD) and one for beta-thalassemia major/sickle cell disease, and an early stage oncology program in partnership with Celgene Corporation.  Join bluebird bio’s enthusiastic and collaborative team by contributing to the overall success of our novel gene therapy approach. This is a hands on position with substantial bench work, driving the strategy for lentiviral vector characterization. The Scientist will be responsible for assay development activities, design of experiments, outsourcing and managing external projects as well as collaborating internally with subject matter experts to gain extensive knowledge about our lentiviral vector products which will ultimately help control its quality and associated manufacturing processes. title: Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) Research Analyst
summary: PIMCO is a global investment solutions provider with more than 2,300 dedicated professionals in 12 countries focused on a single mission: to manage risks and deliver returns for our clients. We are recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients around the world. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities   POSITION DESCRIPTION   PIMCO is launching a new Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) platform that will be able to support new and existing PIMCO Funds and separate account opportunities. We understand that ESG factors can impact the investment risk and return profiles of our investments. We are seeking a senior analyst to join our ESG initiative, and sit within our corporate credit research team. This individual would work closely with our credit research analysts to ensure ESG is embedded into our credit research process, and would be an advocate for ESG internally and externally.   RESPONSIBILITIES   Incorporating analysis of ESG-factors into valuation analysis and ESG-themes into portfolios Engage and empower issuers to influence change in ESG business practices Analyze and present opportunities and risks inherent in potential ESG investments across sectors and markets Fundamental research across a variety of market capitalizations and industries Work with credit analysts globally to identify main ESG risks, and to create specific ESG term-sheets by industry Incorporate MSCI ESG analytics into PIMCO systems Support analysts on ESG related aspects during quarterly results Present to clients on PIMCO ESG integration and sustainability initiative Express views on ESG trends and momentum through PIMCO thought leadership pieces Actively engage with PIMCO analytics on incorporating ESG risks in internal valuation frameworks Collaborate with ESG PM on creating performance attribution for ESG risk factors Analyze and evaluate other third party ESG providers Provide investment recommendations to PMs and Analysts  Position Requirements   POSITION REQUIREMENTS   5-7 years’ experience in research capacity (credit/equity research at sell side/buy side/rating agency) or in ESG related program management Strong proficiency in financial modeling and quantitative analysis required ESG background required May spend small portion of time covering sectors as research analyst, as needed Proven presentation, communication and influencing skills with senior stakeholders MBA and/or CFA strongly preferred  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
